sent_text: If at the termination of any fiscal year the legislature shall have failed to pass appropriation bills providing for payments of the necessary current expenses of the government and meeting its legal obligations for the ensuing fiscal year, then the several sums appropriated in the last appropriation bills for the objects and purposes therein specified, so far as the same may be applicable, shall be deemed to be reappropriated, item by item.
comp_prompt: What happens if the legislature does not pass appropriation bills for the next fiscal year by the end of the current fiscal year?
comp_option:
[ "The amounts from the most recent appropriation bills are treated as reapproved for the same purposes.",
  "All prior appropriations automatically expire and no funds may be used.",
  "The Congress of the United States must immediately enact new appropriation bills.",
  "Only appropriations made before August 1, 1950 remain available to the government."]
comp_correct: "The amounts from the most recent appropriation bills are treated as reapproved for the same purposes."

sent_text: The liquidating agent may disallow any portion of any claim by a creditor or claim of security, preference, or priority which is not proved to the satisfaction of the liquidating agent. No court may review the Board’s determination pursuant to subparagraph (D) to disallow a claim.
comp_prompt: According to the draft provision, who has the authority to disallow a claim and what limits exist on reviewing that decision?
comp_option:
[ "The liquidating agent may disallow a claim, and no court may review that determination.",
  "The liquidating agent may disallow a claim, but a court may review the decision if a creditor objects.",
  "Only a court may disallow a claim after reviewing evidence submitted by the liquidating agent.",
  "The Board may disallow a claim, but the liquidating agent must approve that decision."]
comp_correct: "The liquidating agent may disallow a claim, and no court may review that determination."

sent_text: [A] partnership petition by less than all of the general partners is treated as an involuntary, not a voluntary, petition. The court may, under subsection (e), require the petitioners to file a bond to indemnify the debtor for such amounts as the court may later allow under subsection (i). Subsection (i) provides for costs, attorneys fees, and damages in certain circumstances.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, what may the court require when a partnership petition is treated as involuntary?
comp_option:
["That the petitioners file a bond to cover possible costs, fees, or damages.",
  "That all general partners consent to the petition.",
  "That the debtor immediately pay the petitioners’ attorneys’ fees.",
  "That the petition be converted into a voluntary petition."]
comp_correct: "That the petitioners file a bond to cover possible costs, fees, or damages."

sent_text: Where miners are exposed to danger from falls of roof, face, and ribs the operator shall examine and test the roof, face, and ribs before any work or machine is started, and as frequently thereafter as may be necessary to insure safety. When dangerous conditions are found, they shall be corrected immediately.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, what must the operator do when miners face danger from falls of the roof, face, or ribs?
comp_option:
["Examine and test the roof, face, and ribs before work or machines start and as often as needed afterward, and correct dangerous conditions immediately.",
  "Provide miners with safety training once per fiscal year before any machine is started.",
  "Inspect the roof, face, and ribs only after work has begun and only if a miner reports a problem.",
  "Suspend all mining operations until Congress authorizes additional safety appropriations."]
comp_correct: "Examine and test the roof, face, and ribs before work or machines start and as often as needed afterward, and correct dangerous conditions immediately."

sent_text: The Secretary may readjust the terms and conditions, except as otherwise provided herein, of any geothermal lease issued under this chapter at not less than ten-year intervals beginning ten years after the date the geothermal steam is produced, as determined by the Secretary. Each geothermal lease issued under this chapter shall provide for such readjustment. The Secretary shall give notice of any proposed readjustment of terms and conditions, and, unless the lessee files with the Secretary objection to the proposed terms or relinquishes the lease within thirty days after receipt of such notice, the lessee shall conclusively be deemed to have agreed with such terms and conditions.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, when is a lessee considered to have agreed to a proposed readjustment of a geothermal lease?
comp_option:
["When the lessee does not object to the proposed terms or relinquish the lease within thirty days after receiving notice.",
  "When the Secretary first determines that geothermal steam has been produced under the lease.",
  "When ten years have passed since the lease was originally issued.",
  "When Congress approves the proposed readjustment of the lease terms."]
comp_correct: "When the lessee does not object to the proposed terms or relinquish the lease within thirty days after receiving notice."

sent_text: The Secretary of the Treasury may contribute on behalf of the United States $150,000,000 to the first replenishment of the resources of the Enterprise for the Americas Multilateral Investment Fund. The authority provided by paragraph (1) may be exercised only to the extent and in the amounts provided for in advance in appropriations Acts.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, under what condition may the Secretary of the Treasury make the stated contribution?
comp_option:
["Only to the extent and in the amounts authorized in advance by appropriations Acts.",
  "Whenever the Secretary determines that the contribution is in the national interest.",
  "Automatically upon creation of the Enterprise for the Americas Multilateral Investment Fund.",
  "Only after the Secretary receives written approval from the Fund."]
comp_correct: "Only to the extent and in the amounts authorized in advance by appropriations Acts."
notes: adjusted to remove duplication (new wc: 56; still LLM)

sent_text: In each State, an authorized criminal justice agency of the State shall report child abuse crime information to, or index child abuse crime information in, the national criminal history background check system. A criminal justice agency may satisfy the requirement of this subsection by reporting or indexing all felony and serious misdemeanor arrests and dispositions.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, how may a state criminal justice agency fulfill its obligation regarding child abuse crime information?
comp_option:
["By reporting or indexing child abuse crime information, including through reporting or indexing all felony and serious misdemeanor arrests and dispositions.",
  "By reporting only convictions for child abuse crimes to local law enforcement agencies.",
  "By indexing child abuse crime information only after a court order is issued.",
  "By submitting annual summaries of child abuse investigations to Congress."]
comp_correct: "By reporting or indexing child abuse crime information, including through reporting or indexing all felony and serious misdemeanor arrests and dispositions."

sent_text: A subpoena under this subsection may be served anywhere in the United States. A witness subpoenaed under this subsection shall receive the same fees and expenses as a witness subpoenaed in connection with a civil proceeding in a court of the United States. Nothing in this subsection is intended to allow an alien to have access to classified information.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, what does this subsection provide regarding witnesses who are subpoenaed?
comp_option:
["They may be served anywhere in the United States and are entitled to the same fees and expenses as witnesses in federal civil proceedings.",
  "They may be served only within the state where the proceeding is held and receive reduced fees.",
  "They are entitled to access classified information relevant to their testimony.",
  "They must cover their own expenses unless a court orders otherwise."]
comp_correct: "They may be served anywhere in the United States and are entitled to the same fees and expenses as witnesses in federal civil proceedings."

sent_text: The failure of a court to meet or comply with a time limitation under this section shall not be a ground for granting relief from a judgment of conviction or sentence. The State may enforce a time limitation under this section by petitioning for a writ of mandamus to the court of appeals. The court of appeals shall act on the petition for a writ of mandamus not later than 30 days after the filing of the petition.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, what remedy is available if a court fails to comply with a time limitation under this section?
comp_option:
["The State may petition for a writ of mandamus to the court of appeals.",
  "The defendant is entitled to relief from the judgment or sentence.",
  "The case must be dismissed automatically for lack of timely action.",
  "The court may reopen the judgment on its own initiative."]
comp_correct: "The State may petition for a writ of mandamus to the court of appeals."

sent_text: No funds provided under this section may be used to construct or renovate a building or structure. Section was enacted as part of the America COMPETES Reauthorization Act of 2010, also known as the America Creating Opportunities to Meaningfully Promote Excellence in Technology, Education, and Science Reauthorization Act of 2010, and also as part of the National Science Foundation Authorization Act of 2010, and not as part of the National Science Foundation Act of 1950 which comprises this chapter.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, how may funds provided under this section be used?
comp_option:
["They may not be used to construct or renovate a building or structure.",
  "They may be used only for construction projects authorized by the National Science Foundation Act of 1950.",
  "They may be used to renovate existing facilities but not to construct new ones.",
  "They may be used for any purpose described in the America COMPETES Reauthorization Act of 2010."]
comp_correct: "They may not be used to construct or renovate a building or structure."

sent_text:
An apprentice may:
A) drive a commercial motor vehicle in interstate commerce while participating in the 120-hour probationary period under paragraph (2)(A) or the 280-hour probationary period under paragraph (2)(B) pursuant to an apprenticeship program established by an employer in accordance with this section; and 
(B) drive a commercial motor vehicle in interstate commerce after the apprentice completes an apprenticeship program described in paragraph (2), unless the Secretary determines there exists a safety concern.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, when may an apprentice drive a commercial motor vehicle in interstate commerce?
comp_option:
["While participating in specified probationary periods and after completing the apprenticeship program, unless the Secretary determines there is a safety concern.",
  "Only after completing the apprenticeship program and receiving explicit approval from the Secretary.",
  "Only during the probationary period and not after completing the apprenticeship program.",
  "At any time during training, regardless of probationary status or safety determinations."]
comp_correct: "While participating in specified probationary periods and after completing the apprenticeship program, unless the Secretary determines there is a safety concern."

sent_text: A property and fiscal officer may intrust money to an officer of the National Guard to make disbursements as his agent. Both the officer to whom money is intrusted, and the property and disbursing officer intrusting the money to him, are pecuniarily responsible for that money to the United States. The agent officer is subject, for misconduct as an agent, to the liabilities and penalties prescribed by law in like cases for the property and fiscal officer for whom he is acting.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, what responsibility does an officer have when entrusted with money as an agent?
comp_option:
["Both the agent officer and the property and fiscal officer remain financially responsible to the United States for the money.",
  "Only the agent officer is financially responsible for the money once it is entrusted to him.",
  "Only the property and fiscal officer retains financial responsibility for the money.",
  "Neither officer is financially responsible if the money is used for authorized disbursements."]
comp_correct: "Both the agent officer and the property and fiscal officer remain financially responsible to the United States for the money."

sent_text: The Secretary of the Treasury may by regulation prescribe for plan years beginning after December 31, 1999, mortality tables to be used in determining current liability under this subsection. Such tables shall be based upon the actual experience of pension plans and projected trends in such experience. In prescribing such tables, such Secretary shall take into account results of available independent studies of mortality of individuals covered by pension plans.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, what factors must the Secretary of the Treasury consider when prescribing mortality tables?
comp_option:
["Actual experience and projected trends of pension plans, along with results of available independent mortality studies.",
  "Mortality data from the general population without regard to pension plan experience.",
  "Recommendations issued by Congress for each plan year.",
  "Mortality assumptions used by private insurance companies in non-pension contexts."]
comp_correct: "Actual experience and projected trends of pension plans, along with results of available independent mortality studies."

sent_text: The Librarian shall provide a seal to indicate that a film has been included in the National Film Registry and is the Registry version of that film. The Librarian shall establish guidelines for approval of the use of the seal in accordance with subsection (b). The seal provided under subsection (a)(3) may only be used on film or other approved copies of the Registry version of a film.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, what is the purpose and permitted use of the seal provided by the Librarian?
comp_option:
["To indicate that a film is included in the National Film Registry, and it may be used only on the Registry version of that film or approved copies.",
  "To certify that a film has received federal funding, and it may be used on any distribution of the film.",
  "To identify films approved for public exhibition, and it may be used on all versions of the film.",
  "To indicate that a film has been restored by the Library of Congress, and it may be used only on archival copies."]
comp_correct: "To indicate that a film is included in the National Film Registry, and it may be used only on the Registry version of that film or approved copies."

sent_text: The Secretary may also contract for inspections or examinations in the United States and in foreign countries. The primary reason for including a provision that permits the contracting for the conduct of inspections and examinations is to provide flexibility in foreign areas where Coast Guard marine inspectors are not normally available. A contract inspector may be authorized to act on behalf of the Secretary, but may not issue a certificate of inspection or compliance.

comp_option:
["They may act on behalf of the Secretary to conduct inspections or examinations, but may not issue a certificate of inspection or compliance.",
  "They may issue certificates of inspection and compliance in areas where Coast Guard inspectors are unavailable.",
  "They may conduct inspections only within the United States and not in foreign countries.",
  "They may act independently of the Secretary when performing inspections abroad."]
comp_correct: "They may act on behalf of the Secretary to conduct inspections or examinations, but may not issue a certificate of inspection or compliance."

sent_text: As the Administrator deems necessary in the public interest, the Administrator may direct officers and employees of the Administration to carry firearms while in the conduct of their official duties; and authorize employees of contractors and subcontractors of the Administration who are engaged in the protection of property owned by the United States, and located at facilities owned by or contracted to the United States, to carry firearms while in the conduct of their official duties.
comp_prompt: According to the excerpt, whom may the Administrator authorize to carry firearms while performing official duties?
comp_option:
["Officers and employees of the Administration, as well as certain contractor and subcontractor employees protecting U.S.-owned property.",
  "Only sworn law enforcement officers employed directly by the Administration.",
  "Any federal employee working at a facility owned by the United States.",
  "Only private security contractors hired to protect facilities outside the United States."]
comp_correct: "Officers and employees of the Administration, as well as certain contractor and subcontractor employees protecting U.S.-owned property."
